div1.p: Lazear discusses Sweitzer's upcoming trip to Massachusetts.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 21, 1897
div1.p:
Your letter
came yesterday. I am
glad you are going
to Beverly soon.

You will not have
any trouble at Boston.
Beverly is on the
Boston & Maine R.R. and
there are trains running
out there about every
half hour. At Beverly
you can always get
a carriage at the
station.

It is fortunate that
you do not have
to go to another
station in Boston.
The ride to Beverly
is about 35 minutes.
The carriage man
at Beverly will
attend to the baggage.

Aunt Kate heard from Uncle Tom
a day or two ago. He was
about to start East and
he may come here at any
moment. From what he says
it is impossible to get any
idea of Lytt's condition.
